place.name: WATFORD
place.gazetteerText: WATFORD, a parish in Daventry district, Northampton; on Watling-street, the Grand Union canal, and the Northwestern railway, at Crick r. station, 4¾ miles N NE of Daventry. It has a post-office under Rugby. Acres, 3,080. Real property, £7,276. Pop., 450. Houses, 100. The manor, with W. Court, belongs to Lord Henley. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Peterborough. Value, £309.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good; and there are a Wesleyan chapel, a school, and an education charity £35. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
